dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I was called from school. I can remember it so clearly. I came through the fields. The meadow larks were singing, and the sun was shining.  I carried the knapsack of school books in my hand.  I remember I could not believe that on such a day anyone could die. I was not delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a delirium in great grief. There are the illusions of bereavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The priest would not come into our house when he saw what was on the bed. Was his also an illusion of grief?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Judd has no answer to make for a moment. He flicks a from the path with his cane, then smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is always an explanation for every phenomenon. We shall find the reasonable explanation for this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena gives him a scornful look of disbelief, and turns a as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT of Oliver and Alice. They are at a plotting tabl Oliver is holding a slide rule in his hand, and is callin out numbers as she moves the batten. He looks at the numb on the hairline, and calls It off to Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toward the sheer line...sixty-two degrees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice moves the batten with which she is plotting the cur of a bulkhead to the measurement Oliver has given her.  I takes a sharp, awkward bend.  She looks up at Oliver and points at the batten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks at the batten, grins ruefully and apologizes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Must have given you the wrong figure.  Let me try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming round the table to him) Wait.  Let's have a cigarette first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go toward the water cooler, as he fishes through his pockets for a package of cigarettes. Alice takes a cigare taps it on her nail, and smiles at him. ALICE (cont'd) That's the third wrong figure you've given me this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting careless in my old ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's on your mind. Anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the water cooler.  She lights her cigarette, and accepts the cup of water he hands to her. draws another cup for himself.  She grins at him, as she waves away the first strong puff of smoke from her cigare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly) Must be marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a way, it is. I'm worried about Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  thought she was  going to Dr. Judd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought. But I bumped Into  Judd this  morning, and  she hasn't been there since the first visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you told me she seemed anxious to be cured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice crumples up the paper cup and drops It into the was basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Oliver. It must make you very unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtfully, simply) You know...it's a funny thing... I've never been unhappy before. Things  have always gone swell for me.  I had a grand time as a kid...lots of fun at school... at the office here with you, and the Commodore, and Doc. That's why I don't know what to do about all this. I've just never been unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks at him. Suddenly she begins to cry. Oliver lo at her in astonishment, takes a quick glance to see that other workers in the office have not noticed, and quickly leads her around behind the filing cabinets. OLIVER (cont'd) (drawing out the word) Hey -- (pulling out his handkerchief) Wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blowing her nose) I can't help it.  I just can't help it. (looking up at him) I can't bear to see you unhappy. I love you too darn much, and I don't care if you do know it. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pause) I didn't' know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, you didn't.  What do you think I'd do...drag my blooding heart across the drafting tables?  It just had to come out now.  It's been too hard to love you...to see you in love with Irena...and to  see you unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They  stand looking  at each other.  Alice gives a final to her nose, hands the handkerchief back to Oliver, and manages a grin. ALICE (cont'd) Forgot it.  There's Irena... you're in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (puzzled) I don't know.  All this trouble has made me think -- I don't know what love really is.  I don't oven know whether I'm in love with Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks at him very thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply, sincerely) I know what love is.  It's understanding.  It's you and me...and let the rest of the world go by.  It's just the two of us, living our lives together..happily...proudly.  No self-torture...no doubt.  It's enduring and it's everlasting. Nothing can change it.  Nothing can change us.  That's what I think love is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks over at the water bubbles rising in the cool He looks intently at them, almost as if counting them as rise, burbling to the surface. He speaks without looking Alice, his eyes on the bubbles rising in the water cooler

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel that way about Irena.  It's a different feeling.  I'm drawn to her. There's a warmth from her that pulls at me...I have to watch her when she's in the room. I have to touch her when she's near.  But I don't really know her.  In many ways were strangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at Alice.  She reaches out and takes h hand.  They stand together like two people on a street co shaking hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You  and  I...we'11  never  be strangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles at her and she returns his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena is in the window alcove, busily engaged in washing paint brushes.  She twirls them between her palms to get water out of them.  Oliver is in his easy chair. He holds magazine in his hands, but he is not reading. Suddenly he puts the magazine down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena turns toward him, but continues to twirl the brush she has In her hands. OLIVER (cont'd) (rising and coming toward her) Irena, I'm worried. What's happening to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena looks up at him as she stops twirling her brush. Sh speaks very simply, as if this explained and adjusted all difficulties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I  know  -- but people can love, and people can still drift  apart. And that's what I feel is happening to us.    We don't talk together openly ГўВЂВ” you are  not  frank with me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting)  I have never lied to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran into Dr. Judd today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena looks at him and then down at the brush in her hand OLIVER (cont'd) You haven't been back to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cannot help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't lot him help you. You won't let me help you. You won't even help yourself. It's what I said to Alice this afternoon ГўВЂВ”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the mention of Alice, Irena has repeated the name soft furiously, the while a look of concentrated fury has come her face.  The rest of Oliver's speech has been lost to h through her own anger. OLIVER (cont'd) You're content to go on as we are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly, but savagely sibilant) Alice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks at her. He sees her anger, realizes that she just about to burst forth savagely. He makes a gesture of resignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (restraining himself) I promised you we'd never quarrel. Let's calm down a bit.  (starts toward the door) I'll go down to the office ГўВЂВ” I've got some work to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the door he picks up his hat and coat and goes out, closing the door quietly behind  him.  No sooner has the closed than Irena jumps to  her feet, paces quickly towar it, then back again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver comes up in front of the office building that hous the Consolidated Ship and Barge Construction Company.  A plaque on an entrance cornerstone bears the name of the company.  There has been snow, followed by thaw, so that streets are wet. Oliver stands on the wet street, watchin the revolving door slowly move around with abrupt jerks. one, however, is in any of the door compartments.  Then a the door comes around, we see that in one of the compartments, on her hands and knees, scrubbing the floor a thin charwoman, Mrs. Agnew, her blowsy hair falling dow over her face. As she gets around in front of Oliver, she looks up, brushing the hair out of her eyes. A lighted cigarette, with a long ash dangles from one corner of her mouth.  She picks up her bucket and scrubbing brush and starts to move out of Oliver's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go up to the office, Mr. Reed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think I'll go around the corner to Sally Lunn's and get a cup of coffee before I got to work. (starting off down the street) I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Agnew nods. The long ash of her cigarette falls down front of her dress. She brushes off the ashes with ladyli strokes, as if it were a usual occurrence,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver comes into the tearoom.  It is a typical quaint tearoom of the type seen in Manhattan side streets. A Neg waitress, Minnie, dressed in a stylized soubrette costume (something like the kind worn by the Brown Derby waitress turns around as Oliver enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a broad smile as he sits down) Maybe you'd like some nice chicken gumbo, Mr. Reed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thanks, Minnie.  How about some apple pie and a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Yes'r, Mr. Reed. (as she turns to get his order) My goodness, don't nobody like chicken gumbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is working alone late at night. She has just hung u the last T-square on the back wall. Now she turns out the light above her desk, leaving the room illuminated by a single light near the door. On her under-lit drafting table, taking full advantage of the warmth, his forepaws snuggled under his chin, is the most decorous sort of office cat. He looks like a bookkeeper. Alice is putting her hat when the telephone rings.  She picks up the phone

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Into phone) Hello. (no response) Hello. (still no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena has the telephone in her hand, and over the phone w hear Alice's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello  -- Hello  ГўВЂВ”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena quietly hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a faint click from the other end of the wire, as a receiver being put softly back onto the cradle. Alice, disgusted, slams her own receiver into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (addressing the cat) John Paul Jones, don't you hate people who do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs her coat and starts putting it on.  She turns o the last remaining light and starts to leave the office. the door she pauses and calls through to the cat. ALICE (cont'd) Good night,  John Paul. (closes door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Along the rooftop of the building opposite Irena's apartm glide a couple of mangy alley oats.  They lead into the scene. Seeing Irena's lighted window, they seat themselve the parapet side and look down into the lighted square of window. Through it Irena can be seen on her knees, her ha folded in prayer. Her lips are moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: :fI*bm^;:VohlMv;th6?ae^h^1M'V/Г‚В¦::,iV^ cat in line; a l further to one side than the other. From this vantage poi we can see down into Irena's apartment. We now see the object of Irena's adoration and her plea: the statue of King John of Serbia. Suddenly, Irena rises swiftly to her feet, and with a quick, violent movement she sweeps the statue to the floor. The cats, frightened, scamper away over the rooftops. The CAMERA MOVES toward the window, as we see Irena catch her hat and coat and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice comes out of the elevator.  Mrs. Agnew is in the lo and has risen to a sitting position on her knees. She has Just finished lighting a fresh cigarette. Alice reaches I her pocketbook and takes out a couple of match books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, Mrs. Agnew, I've got a couple of new match books for your collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Miss Moore. (admiring a particular one) Chartreuse.  My, ain't that elegant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice smiles and starts out. MRS. AGNEW (cont'd) Too bad you wasn't here a minute ago. Mr. Reed looked in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping) Oh? Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said he was going around the corner to Sally Lunn's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting off) I'll see if I can catch him, Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night, Miss Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ash of her cigarette falls down on her dress again. Almost automatically she brushes it off with her customar ladylike gesture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice enters the tearoom and stands beside Oliver. She signals to Minnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you squeeze the coffee pot for me, Minnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns and sees Alice) Hello !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure could. Only this coffee's been workin' so long, it's got muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice smiles at Oliver as she sits down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in this part of town at this hour of night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver shrugs his shoulders.  Alice nods. ALICE (cont'd) Hmmm.  Stormy weather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena as SHOT in the reflection of a florist shop window. She is walking with fast, soft steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver have finished drinking their coffee. She looking very seriously at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ollie,  you're  going to have  to solve your problems your own way. (picking up her cup) I'm going to drink up and go home.    You'd better go home,  too, and make it up with Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning over and patting her hand) You're very swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lightly) That's what makes me dangerous. I'm the new type of other woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave the counter, calling "good nights" to Minnie, turns and nods to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As SHOT through the plate glass window of the florist sho with a grouping of tiger lilies in the f.g. Irena stands an alcove-entrance, watching Oliver and Alice as they go TWO SHOT - Oliver and Alice.  Alice stops, shivers, and d the collar of her coat higher. Oliver turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) A cat just walked over my grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other and move on. CLOSE SHOT of Irena through the tiger lilies, as she look after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver pause at the entrance to the transverse, which stretches away from them, Its darkness punctuated w pools of widely spaced street lights.  Alice looks up the street and turns to Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you want me to walk you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a big girl now, and I'm not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.  Oliver turns and starts off across the street, Alice waves good night to him as he reaches the o side; then she draws a deep breath of the cold, crisp nig air, and turning, starts toward the transverse walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena steps out from the shadows around the park wall. Sh draws up her fur collar over the lower part of her face a turns toward the transverse walk. On the sound track the music for "Berceuses du Chat" begins in an eerie, minor k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena pauses at the entrance to the transverse. Ahead of walking briskly about one hundred feet in advance is Alic There are no other pedestrians on the narrow transverse w The street and sidewalk are glistening wet and reflect th pools of light from the street lamps. The melting snow dr down the stone walls.  Irena turns into the transverse an starts to walk after Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of Alice, as she walks along. On one side of her are high, rock walls of the transverse; on the other is the street. SHOT of Irena, as she, too, walks along. MED. SHOT - street lamp on transverse.  It throws a circu pool of light, Alice emerges from the darkness, crosses t area of light, and continues on into the darkness.  The s click of her heels fades into the distance. Even as the s of her steps fades, the sound of Irena's steps comes into scene. Irena comes from the darkness, crosses the area of light, and continues oh after Alice into the darkness. CLOSEUP of Alice's feet as they walk along, the heels clicking on the wet pavement. CLOSEUP of Irena's feet as they walk along, her heels likewise clicking on the pavement. MED. SHOT of a lighted area, as Alice again walks through circle of light.  She walks directly through and into the darkness beyond, her footsteps clicking on the pavement. her footsteps fade, we would logically hear Irena's steps coming onto the scene. But we do not. There is nothing, o the sound of Alice's heels fading into the distance.  The music of the "Berceuses du Chat" rises and fades. SHOT of Alice as she walks along, the CAMERA TRUCKING wit her. There is the sound of her feet on the pavement. She stops in a pool of street light, frowning, sensing the presence of something behind her. She glances over her shoulder, then looks around. The music is growing louder. LONG SHOT of the glistening wet transverse walk, as Alice sees it -- a dark, deserted walk, fading off to a perspec line. It is lighted by regularly spaced street lamps. SHOT of Alice, as she peers more closely into the darknes She  is troubled.  The silence is ominous. She frowns apprehensively, turns, and starts to walk on a little fas She turns her head slightly, but does not dare look behin her. She increases her pace and walks very rapidly throug the next area of light and on into the darkness.  The sou of her own steps is loud, and she begins to run. She reac the next pool of light, stops stock still, panic-stricken afraid to move. Outside the circle of light is only black and silence, Alice's frightened eyes poor into the darkne She shrinks against the lamp post. Sheer terror crosses h face. Suddenly there is a roaring sound that fills the so track, completely drowning the loud music. A pattern of l cuts across Alice's face. She throws up one arm, almost a to defend herself.  There is a hissing, screeching sound. SHOT of a transverse bus, as with a hiss of air brakes it stops directly alongside Alice.  She grasps the platform to steady herself.  The doors open. BUS DRIVER Climb on, sister. Alice steps up. A snarl sounds in the darkness, looks beh her. Her eyes are carried upward. The wet shrubbery at the top of wall stirs, settling, as something had only that moment passed through it. Alice is looking back over her shoulder, fascinated by wh she has seen. She is standing just within the bus, but th driver cannot close the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Are you ridin' with me, or ain'tcha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice nods weakly, and steps In.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice Is fumbling in her purse for change. She has been greatly shaken by her fright. Her hands are trembling. Th bus driver looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look as if you'd seen a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eagerly) Did you see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver looks at her in amazement.  Abashed, Alice dro a coin in the box and moves on.  The driver shakes his he morosely, as if crazy women were the cause of all misfortune in this world, and pulls the gear that operate the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waterfowl are nesting on the shallow, reed-fringed sh of the lake. Their heads are tucked in under their wings. Suddenly, one of the fowl, the leader, comes to life, and starts to cluck. CLOSE SHOT - the tall reeds swaying, moving unnaturally, If something wore stealing quietly behind them. All the birds have wakened now, and silently are swimming to the safety of the deeper water in the middle of the la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mounted policeman, in glistening raincoat and cape, sit quietly on his horse.  A cone of lamplight illuminates hi Overhead, from the bridge, a dark shadow glides. There is deadened sound or padded paws on the stonework of the bri The horse, sensing the presence and hearing the sound, re suddenly and plunges. The policeman struggles to rein in maddened animal. The policeman gets the horse in hand, although it continu to snort and start nervously. He bends down from the sadd to pat the horse's lathered neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What got into you, Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the sheepfold there is panic. The sheep mill about the darkness, leaping over each other in blind fright, bleating piteously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caretaker comes out of his hut, with a lantern. He ha been roused from his sleep, and goes toward the fold, muttering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woolly fools!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caretaker stumbles over something on the ground insid the sheepfold.  He holds up his lantern. CLOSE SHOT of a killed lamb lying torn on the muddy groun The muddy soil around the dead animal Is trampled. The caretaker raises his lantern higher, and peers into t light. The bodies of three more slain lambs lying on the earth, revealed by the caretaker's lantern. The caretaker hobbles over to the last body, pausing for just a second at the body of each lamb on the way. He reaches the last body, and kneels down beside it, examini the ground. CLOSE SHOT of the prints of an animal In the soft mud aro the body of the fourth lamb. CAMERA MOVES a few feet beyond the body.  Here, going off toward the sheep pasture gate, are more prints, but not t prints of the animal.  Those are the dainty imprints of a woman's slippered-foot. The caretaker, stunned and a little frightened by what he seen, brings a whistle up to his lips,and blows it shrill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena is standing under a street lamp.  She seems dazed a bewildered.  She is dabbing at her lips with her handkerchief.  The caretaker's whistle is blowing in the distance. Irena frowns, puzzled, irresolute. Another whis closer, responds to the caretaker's whistle. A taxi drive and stops beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taxi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena looks up, nods and gets into the cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver is pacing the floor.  The room lights are on full. is smoking a cigarette nervously.  There is the sound of door being opened.  Oliver turns around. Irena has let herself In.  She closes the door behind her leans up against it.  She is blinking in the glare of the light,  She looks ghastly, white, and drawn, her shoes an stockings are wet, muddied, torn.  She has lost her hat, her hair is in wild disorder.  In her hand she is crumpli and re-crumpling a soiled lace handkerchief. TWO SHOT of Irena and Oliver.  Irena's exhaustion is so g that she looks as if she were about to collapse. Oliver j quickly to her side, putting his arm around her waist to support her.  She draws away from him,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...please...don't touch me...don't come near me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver hesitates and looks at her with sympathy. OLIVER (cont'd) Look, Irena, I'm sorry. I've been worried to death.  I didn't know where you were. I thought..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause. She turns away from him. OLIVER (cont'd) These things...what happened tonight...happen in every family. I was all on edge.  You've got to understand, and you've got to forgive me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena starts toward her room, mumbling brokenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forgive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stumbles.  Oliver tries to help her, but she eludes h hand and slips into her room.  Oliver stands at the close door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has turned on the water taps and is filling the tub with water. She is pulling off her wet clothes as rapidly as she  can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver stands at the door to Irena's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena? Irena?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the sound of running water) What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver Is worried. INT. IRENA'S BATHROOM - NIGHT . CLOSEUP of the base of an old-fashioned bathtub that has floor supports of ornamental balls with tiger claws exten down over the tops. Over the scene comes the broken sobbi of Irena. CAMERA MOVES UP, and we see Irena In the tub. She sits ve still in the still water, but her glistening shoulders sh as she tries to control the storm of her hysteria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of Irena sleeping. She moves slightly in her sleep. Her lips move as if she were trying to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPECIAL EFFECT SHOT. An army of gigantic, thin, angular c marches up from the back of the screen until their weird shapes, and glowing eyes fill the entire screen from fram frame. Then through their ranks comes stalking a knight i chain armor with ragged grave cerements for cloak and tab He is unearthly tall and, as he walks forward, it is as i statue were moving. It is the same figure we have seen on horseback as King John of Serbia. The face under the crow helmet is in darkness. When he comes up close, this darkn is divided and reveals the face of Dr. Judd. Suddenly, an with a savage movement, this knightly figure draws his sw It comes flashing from the scabbard and instantly changes an enormous Yale key on a ring. The key grows constantly larger, blotting out everything else from the screen. Ove this sequence is the music of "Berceuses du Chat" in the softer portions of the melody we hear constantly the repetition of Judd's suggestions:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over EFFECT SHOT) Go loose evil upon the world -- a psychic necessity ГўВЂВ” a desire for death-- to loose evil --a desire for death -- to loose evil ГўВЂВ” a desire for death ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We LAP DISSOLVE BACK to Irena's face in such a manner tha seems this enormous key were pressing down upon her in he sleep.                                 .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light rain is falling. Once more the keeper is singing himself in his nasal voice as he pushes chunks of meat in the beast. He looks up to see Irena standing at the guard rail and smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The animals must love you. You feed them so promptly...the same time every day.  One could set one's watch by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you,  ma'am. It ain't that the animals like me, though.     I tell you, they'd just as leave have me for their dinner,  even if they was to get everlastin1 dyspepsia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think they'd find you indigestible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This strikes the keeper as being very amusing.    He chuc to himself and absent-mindedly moves on to the next cage. Irena looks at the door Of the panther's cage. THE KEY to the panther's cage has been left in the lock again by the keeper. BACK TO SCENE, Irena looks around her, making sure that n one is near enough to see her. Very quietly she opens the little gate, takes out the key and slips it in her purse. steps back onto the promenade, closing the gate behind he The keeper looks up; he is still chuckling. Irena smiles looks toward the black panther. CLOSEUP of the black panther's face as the beast stares a her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of a grinning cat's face which adorns the bowhead the end of the timber projecting at right angles from the of a model ship. CAMERA DRAWS BACK for CLOSE SHOT of Irena looking at the model. It is the "Royal Harry,11 progenitor of the mighty British fleet. But what obviously holds Irena's interest the cat's face. She is fascinated. THREE SHOT - Alice and Oliver in the f.g.and Irena in the b.g. Alice and Oliver are engrossed in their examination frame model of the privateer, "Swallow". They move over t the next, model, which brings them beside Irena. Alice st and looks at Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid this is dull for Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena, aroused from her absorption in the quaint cat face the "Royal Harry," comes to herself with a start. Oliver takes her elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, darling, there are some beautiful moderns upstairs. Why don't you take a look at them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like  these little boats.     I want  to be with you.  (looking up at  Oliver; pouting) Don't send me  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently and lightly) We're not sending you away.  We just don't want you to be bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena looks at him.  Her mood changes, as she feels that perhaps they do want to be rid of her.  She walks off. OLIVER (cont'd) (calling after her) We'll meet you in the main lobby in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's attention is attracted by a set of line drawings. She turns to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ollie, look!  Line drawings of the "America!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They begin to examine the drawings,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena paces the museum corridors.  She walks alone, the CAMERA TRACKING with her.  A sullen look is on her face a her lips are heavy with sulkiness.  She passes a showcase filled with terra cotta figurines of the cat-headed goddess, Bubastis.  She only glances at them as she passe Her stride lengthens with her growing anger.  At the end the aisle she stops still and looks up. As SHOT from Irene's VIEWPOINT, looking up, we see a towering effigy of the goddess Bubastis, carved into a black basalt caryatid.  The huge cat head is supported by lovely, slim, women's neck, rising from rounded, feminine shoulders.  The goddess gazes down at Irena from blind, enigmatic, cat's eyes. Irena, as she looks up at this dread goddess of the noond sun, seems to reach a resolve. Her expression grows grim, resolute.  She turns, and walks quickly away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena walks through the main lobby toward the exit door. She pauses for a moment beside a greet bronze statue of a puma leaping on a frightened horse, and looks toward the ship exhibit room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As SHOT from the lobby, from Irena's VIEWPOINT, with the bronze statue of the puma and the horse in the f.g. We can see Alice and Oliver within the exhibit room, with their backs turned, closely Inspecting a ship model.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING through the intricacies of the puma-and-horse statue at Irena, who looks a moment at Alice and Oliver, then turns, and walks out of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab drives up in front of the hotel and Alice gets out. She waves good-bye to Oliver, and the cab drives off with him.  She turns and enters the hotel. The streets are sti wet.  Just as Alice is passing through the door, another cab drives up.  Irena gets out.  She pays the driver, and the cab moves off.  Irena stands for a moment irresolutel under the marquee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, striding cheerfully across the lobby, stops at the desk, where a young blonde desk attendant is stationed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could I have the key to the swimming pool? .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, dearie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant gives Alice the key. A little black kitten suddenly jumps up onto the desk top. Alice picks it up an holds it against her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a darling kitten!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  It's one of four. Minou had 'em about a month ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice laughs and putting the kitten down on top of the de starts toward a stairs where there is a placard marked "T THE SWIMMING POOL" the kitten jumps down from the desk to and starts after Alice.  The blonde leans over the desk. BLONDE (cont'd) (calling out) Qh, dearie! When you get through, don't forgot to turn off the light, will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't forget!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts down the stairs.  The little kitten follows he The desk phone rings, and the blonde picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hullo...Ah, gee -- I can't tonight. I got Civilian Defense work...Yeah. As I was saying to Brenda, them Japs and Nazis is whittling down my social life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena is walking irresolutely back and forth underneath t lighted marquee.  Suddenly, she seems to come to some decision and walks up the lighted steps toward the entran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The desk clerk is still talking over the phone as Irena c quietly up to the counter. The blonde glances up and sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute, dearie. (looking up, to Irena)  Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Miss Moore in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just went downstairs to the swimming pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be all right if I went down to see her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, dearie.  Right down them steps there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena nods and goes toward the steps.  The blonde picks u the phone again and continues. BLONDE (cont'd) As I was sayin' to Brenda...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is standing in front of her locker, drying herself a big towel.  She has just come out of the pool. The door the plunge is open behind her, but she has turned out the lights and it is dark within.  There is only the single l gleaming in the locker room. Alice removes her wet bathin cap and shakes her hair out.  She puts on a chenille wrap over her bathing suit and goes toward the door.  She star to turn out the lights in the locker room, but remembers kitten. She looks around and sees the kitten. CLOSE SHOT of the little black kitten.  It is standing on threshold, looking up toward the stairs.  Its tiny ears a raised, listening. SHOT of Alice, as she looks from the kitten toward the stairs. SHOT of the stairway, as Alice sees it. A shaft of light comes down the stairs. The rest of the stairway is in darkness. No one is on the stairs. CLOSE SHOT of the black kitten.  Its back begins to arch. Suddenly it turns, scampers through the locker room, leap the wall, clambers over the top sill of the half-opened window, and drops into the areaway. Alice shrugs her shoulders good-humoredly.  She turns out lights in the locker room and steps toward the entrance d She pauses as she hears something ahead of her and looks trying to peer into the darkness. SHOT of the hallway, as Alice sees it.  It is in shadow. the scene is the sound of padded feet on pavement. Alice starts toward the hall.  A snarl sounds in the dark ahead of her.  She pauses, rooted in panic, as the slow, stealthy tread of feet starts again.  She looks toward th stairs. Alice, with terror in her eyes, looks into the darkness. The locker room, SHOOTING toward the door, as Alice sees All is blackness. Alice takes a step backward.  She looks behind her, and pauses an instant.  She turns, flings off the robe, throw toward something in the blackness, and races through the locker room toward the pool.  We hear the splash of her d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of Alice in the pool, as she swims rapidly out to th center.  Behind her there is a frustrated snarl of rage, sound of fanged teeth ripping, sharp claws snagging into cloth. Alice reaches the center of the pool and treads wa Around the edge of the tank she can hear her pursuer begi run with bounding steps along the tiles.  Then there is silence.  Alice looks about her in the quiet darkness. He eyes try to peer into the shadows.  Her whole expression one of taut, almost hysterical panic.  She listens closel CLOSEUP of a little wave of water, as it slaps against th side of the tank. Alice, as she hears the water, afraid that the thing may slipped into the pool. She looks around her in terror. Sh begins to scream. Her cries race around the empty room, e back at her from the dark end of the pool, and are thrown back at her from the high, beamed ceiling.

SERIES of THREE QUICK SHOTS, over which are the echoes of Alice's voice screaming for help. First, the empty dark room. Then, the black surface of the pool. Then, the high, beamed ceiling. SHOT of Alice, as she thrashes about in the water, scream the sound track filled with the sound of her voice and th mocking echoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blonde, still telephoning, hears the cries for help. slams up the receiver and runs out from behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hanson! Mrs. Hanson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hanson,,a buxom Scandinavian, comes running into the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P3r barmhertighetens skull...  (breaks off, hearing the cries)  Kom med skynda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Hanson and the blonde run toward the stairs and star down them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice's voice is gone. Her strength is ebbing. She paddle weakly around in the water. There is a sharp shriek and t room is flooded with light. Alice looks, in the direction the metallic click. SHOT of Irena, as she stands by the electric switch, dres immaculately as Alice had last seen her, calm, poised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Is the matter, Alice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of Alice as she stares back at Irena. Mrs. Hanson and the blonde come running down the stairs crying in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vad fattas, Miss Moore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gee whiz, dearie, you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, glancing toward Irena, has recovered her poise. Sh explains lamely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nothing.  It was dark down here. Mrs. Reed, coming in unexpectedly, frightened me. I'm terribly sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of Irena, as she smiles at the women, and then looks back toward Alice. Mrs. Hanson and the blonde breathe sighs of relief, and s back toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ({to herself) Jag ar glad att allt &r v&lbestSlt med er.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice has no desire to be left in the same room with Iren alone and she calls out to the women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go.  I'm coming right out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts swimming toward the edge of the pool. SHOT of Irena, as she smiles and starts toward the stairs Alice and Irena. Alice has taken hold of the edge of the pool.  Irena bends down, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I disturbed you, Alice. I missed you and Oliver. I thought you might know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We looked for you at the museum, You'll probably find him at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't mind, then, I'll run on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena goes up the stairs. As Irena disappears up the stai Alice comes in from the pool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the blonde)  Would you get me my robe?  I left It over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blonde picks it up and examines it. She looks up with genuine amazement on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, honey, it's torn to ribbons!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks at the robe, taking it in her hands. INSERT  THE TORN ROBE in Alice's hands.  It is literally to shreds. BACK TO SCENE. Alice looks down at the robe thoughtfully,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a small,feminine room of the type to be seen in women's hotels, where the guests may receive gentlemen callers. Alice is seated on a sofa, smoking a cigarette. Judd is beside her. His hat and coat lie on a near-by cha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming at so late an hour, Dr. Judd. I phoned you because I am troubled. I think you can help me. (pauses and looks at him closely) How much do you believe about the cat people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat people? The story Mrs. Reed told me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice nods. JUDD (cont'd) I believe, my dear Miss Moore, exactly what I told Mrs. Reed. The story is a product of her own fears, her own overworked imagination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you say, Dr. if I were to tell you that believe Irena's story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twice I have been followed by something that was not human, something that attempted to take my life.  I believe that was the cat form of Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should she wish to harm you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks at him a moment. She determines to tell him t truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quietly) Because I am in love with her husband.-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd is highly amused. He chuckles to himself as he settl back in the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my dear Miss Moore, the story grows more and more charming. And simpler all the time, too. You are both victim of fear. Mrs. Reed fears the past and you fear the present. Mrs. Reed has a very strong imagination, and you have an equally strong conscience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a victim of fear, Dr. Judd. The danger that threatened me was very real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head) You disappoint me, Miss Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks at his smiling face. Quietly she reaches down beside her and brings forth the torn robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is my robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd examines the robe. The smile fades from his face. He looks up at Alice's serious expression and shrugs his shoulders. He gives the robe back to her. Both rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To understand this, I would first have to hear Mrs. Reed's version of the story myself. That should be a most interesting interview*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't advise you to see her alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think I am afraid of so charming a lady?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't believe me, Doctor but you must be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You want me to carry some means of protection ГўВЂВ” a gun, perhaps, with a silver bullet...is that what you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused in spite of herself) ) If you're lucky enough to have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling; lightly, not gravely menacing)  Of course, this isn't silver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twists the top of his stick and pulls out a short, ste rapier. He smiles at Alice. She nods to him in dismissal. With a little shrug, he pushes the dagger back into the c and with a bow starts to leave the room. JUDD (cont'd) Good night, Miss Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks down thoughtfully at the torn robe she holds her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice stands for a moment before the telephone. In back o her, Oliver can be seen working at the desk. She turns, h looks at him a moment, and then, picking up the phone, st to dial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena is working at her drawing table.  She has on her sm The telephone rings, and Irena picks it up. In the b.g, t empty bird cage swings in the cold winter sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. (a little, frown, as she recognizes the voice) ) Alice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I didn't sleep last night, Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Oh, darling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice pauses for a moment, looking over at Oliver. Then s turns back to the phone, and the blunt truth comes boldly from her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate me, Irena, don't you? You hate me so much that twice you have tried to kill me, haven't you? (pausing, then continuing) That night on the Transverse... again last night in the swimming pool...that was you, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smile, the innocence have left Irena's face. A look o dread horror takes their place.  She leans against the ta for support.  Her tone is imploring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Don't say that, I don't remember last night. I don't remember. It isn't true. You mustn't say it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice realizes by Irena's desperate tone that Irena in he human form is entirely ignorant of what she may do in som other guise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I am sorry, Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and turns around, looking at Oliver, draws a deep breath and starts back to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena places the phone back on the desk. She leans forwar one troubled hand, brushing the hair back from her forehe In the b.g. the empty bird cage fills the scene. The sun throws the shadows of the bars across her face. Irena com to a decision, rises, and throwing on a fur coat over her smock, leaves the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of Judd at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me...help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd looks in her direction calmly through the arch of hi joined fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you have lapses of memory for which you cannot account...they are becoming more frequent...and you are afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT of Irena and Judd. She is looking at him imploringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot help you. You are not truthful with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am.  I have told you everything. I have not lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd comes around the desk to stand beside her, bends dow and places his hand on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you sincerely believe that if your husband were to kiss you, you would change into a cat and rend him to bits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down) I don't know...I am only afraid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bonding closer) And if I were to kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away from him so that his hand falls from her shoulder) I don't know, I only know that I should not like to be kissed by you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Judd seats himself on the edge of his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he looks intently at her) My dear Mrs. Reed, sometimes, in my profession, there comes a contest of will between the doctor and his patient. The patients are clever...oh, very clever...and they can fool the doctor...sometimes. You are very clever and, perhaps you enjoy this little game you are having with me. But, in the end, I will discover your secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperately) Dr. Judd, believe me...I beg you to believe,me. I have no secrets.  I have told you everything. I have not lied to you. I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot help you when you refuse to confide in me. But I can warn you. These hallucinations approach insanity ГўВЂВ” this nonsense about Miss Moore- in the park and at the swimming pool ГўВЂВ” it is a deterioration of the mind ГўВЂВ” the escape into fantasy ГўВЂВ” and it is dangerous ГўВЂВ”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans forward and shakes his forefinger before her fac JUDD (cont'd) At this moment I could go before n board and have you put away for observation. (his voice drops to a confidential tone) You are that close to real insanity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment they face each other, and frightened. Irena is shaken JUDD (cont'd) I cannot help you. You can only help yourself. You keep going back to the mad legends of your birthplace. Forget them. You surround yourself with cat objects ГўВЂВ” pictures ГўВЂВ” get rid of them. Lead a normal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rises, puts his arm about her shoulder, and starts lea her toward the door. At the door Irena looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Softly) For the first time you have been kind to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is because you interest me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Irena walks out, he stands at the door watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Irena are sitting at a little table drawn up before the fireplace. They have finished dinner. Only the empty dessert plates and the empty demitasse cups remain. fire is burning bright, but low. Above the mantle is an e space. The Goya has been removed. Later, as the CAMERA SHIFTS, we will notice that the Grandville drawings and t panther screen have also been taken away. Oliver is looki down at his empty coffee cup, lost in thought. Irena is watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver does not look up. IRENA (cont'd) I've been to Dr. Judd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks up Irena looks first at him, then at the emp space where the Goya had hung. He follows her gaze and notices that it is no longer there. They look at each oth IRENA (cont'd) I am no longer afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks at her very thoughtfully; then he rises and starts around the table toward her. She rises expectantly almost as if preparing herself for his kiss. She stands smiling. A step away from her he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Irena -- I had hoped - things have changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena still smiles at him, but there is more inquiry than invitation in her smile. Oliver finds the words he wants say and says them with blunt simplicity. OLIVER (cont'd) I don't love you, Irena.  I love Alice. I've always loved her, but I didn't know it.  I had to learn maybe through this marriage of ours -- what love was.  I didn't want to tell you this. But now, you see, I have to.  It's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of Irena. Oliver's words. She has tears in her eyes as she echoes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena and Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no one's fault...neither yours, nor mine.  I'm sorry we've caused each other unhappiness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking tip at him) You gave me happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sinks down on the edge of the sofa.  Oliver faces her is obvious that he is trying to be very practical and mat of-fact. He takes this attitude from a sense of kindness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There seems only one decent thing for me to do -- I'll give you a divorce. Believe me, it is better this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better? Better for whom?  (she pauses, averts her face and then says brokenly) I am being loft alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of Oliver. Her words have affected him greatly He tries to say something but Is struck by the futility o anything he can say and does not speak. (Note to director If necessary to get over this thought, you might lot him start and swallow the word "Irena" as if he were going to more.) Irena. She looks at him. As she looks, her mood changes; anger comes to her face and it is almost as if with this flood of anger, her grasp on reality and sanity relaxed. Although her voice lowers, it gains in intensity.  (Note director:  There are a great many "s" sounds in the follo speech and, if possible, they should be emphasized so tha can almost hear the spitting of a cat in her voice. The w between should be held in low key. The facial expression tense and presages the immobility of her face in the comi scene with Judd.) IRENA (cont'd) Speak.    You can't speak --   there's nothing  you can say.     There's  only silence.    But  I love silence ГўВЂВ”  I love loneliness   -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena and  Oliver.     He kneels down beside her alarmed her  tone and very concerned.     Irena turns  away from hiding her face In the back of the sofa.     Her two hand rest on the back,  stiffly,  claw-like. IRENA (cont'd) (in the same low voice but growing more incoherent as she goes on) I don't care.  I am not a woman. I can feel fierce pleasures a woman never knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grows completely incoherent, pouring forth torrential the meaningless words. IRENA (CONT'D) (cont'd) In me --- they are in me --- their warmth --ГўВЂВ” their strengthГўВЂВ” their softness -- lonely ГўВЂВ” dark ГўВЂВ” silent ГўВЂВ” silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver bends close to her and shakes her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena ГўВЂВ” you're talking, like an insane woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena fights for self-control. We can see her fingers dig deep into the upholstery. Then her voice comes, throaty a vibrant with attempted control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please --- please go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks at her, concerned, reluctant. IRENA (cont'd) I want you to go ГўВЂВ” go ГўВЂВ” please, go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver gets up hesitantly and goes toward the door. He lo back, sees her tensely quiet on the sofa, picks up his ha and coat, looks again, his face showing worry and concern Finally he leaves, closing the door softly behind him. Irena's two hands rip downward, the nails slashing the th fabric of the sofa covering. Oliver is dialing a number. There is a tense look of urge on his face. He gets a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Louis Judd, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open the scene with a CLOSE SHOT of the kitchen door a opens outward into the restaurant. It is held open for a moment as Minnie, the waitress, gets her tray through. On back of the door, a placard reads:

dialogues.speaker: PUSH THE CHICKEN GUMBO TODAY
dialogues.text: Sally Lunn, Manager Through this door Minnie comes, bearing a tray on which i piece of apple pie, a dish of Bavarian cream, another of Roquefort cheese, and three cups of coffee. CAMERA PANS with her as she proceeds across the restauran with mincing steps. She is followed by a large, sinuous b cat. Minnie comes up to a booth in which Alice, Oliver an Dr. Judd are seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bavarian cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver indicates Alice's place. MINNIE (cont'd) Roquefort?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver indicates Dr. Judd. MINNIE (cont'd) And you get the apple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She serves the three cups of coffee and retires with the tail aloft and proudly waving, pacing behind her. Judd resumes a conversation that has obviously been interrupte the waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have pointed out two alternatives, Mr. Reed. Either have her put away for observation and restraint or have your marriage annulled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's tough for Oliver either way, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a psychiatrist I should recommend that you have her put away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks first into Oliver's face and then into Alice's. JUDD (cont'd) As your friend, however, I have much more reasonable advice to offer. I think you should have your marriage annulled. In this way you are free of responsibility. You two could marry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if Irena is sent away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The law is very explicit. One cannot divorce an insane person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's not well, I am going to take care of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at Oliver)  It's the only right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) As you will. I shall have the commitment papers drawn up and arrange an interview with Mrs. Reed tonight at her apartment. Let's say 6 o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver and Alice nod agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ormolu clock on the mantel indicates that it Is now 7 It rings, the half hour. The apartment is as we first saw all the pictures are back; the screen is up. Alice has ju taken a record off the phonograph. Now she puts on anothe one. It is the Berceuse. Oliver stops the machine and tak off the record with an apologetic smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not play that. (looking at his watch) I don't think Irena's coming. We've waited an hour and a half. I don't think she Intends to come. She's probably walking in the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of Judd as he rises and picks up his coat, hat, and gloves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps it Is useless to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his walking stick. INSERT     JUDD'S WALKING STICK resting on the sofa. BACK TO SCENE.  Judd smiles and quietly pushes the stick under the cushions. WO SHOT - Oliver and Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get back to the office, Ollie. We've had a terribly broken~up day. There's lots of work to be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suits me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver have just started down the stairs. Dr. Judd pauses to strike his forehead with his gloved fingertips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How stupid! I left my walking stick in the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping Oliver) No, no. It is my fault. Give me the key. I shall only be a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver gives Judd the key; Judd starts down the hall. SHOT of Judd, as he opens the door to Irena's apartment a goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd crosses the room in the half-light, having left the to the apartment open. He picks up his walking stick from under the pillow, and starts back. CLOSE SHOT of Judd at the door. He takes the key out of t lock. INSERT     JUDD'S HANDS, as he slips the latch off the lo BACK TO SCENE.  Judd lets himself out, closing the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd rejoins Oliver and Alice. He returns the key to Oliv

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Thank you so much.  I should be quite lost without my walking stick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Alice.  They start down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver have turned on the light in the office. Oliver is sitting down at the desk, a thoughtful look on face. Alice has taken off her coat, and is just removing hat. As she pats her hair into shape, she gets a look at Oliver's face. She comes over to him and touches his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, Ollie. It'll come out all right.  It must.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and smiles at her,  John Paul Jones, the office cat, walks across the drafting table in front of Alice, jumps down and crosses to the door.  He scratches to be l out. ALICE (cont'd) (as she goes to open the door for him) All right, John Paul -- I don't ask questions ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door.  John Paul passes through with dignit and Alice returns to her drafting table, leaving the offi door slightly ajar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a list of measurements and starts reading the out. OLIVER (cont'd) Three and a quarter.,.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking up the batten, reporting the measurement) Three and a quarter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver has reached the end of the list, the last number. He calls out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one and three eighths!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (repeating, as she bonds the batten into shape) And one and three eighths! (looking up at Oliver) There!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at Oliver, who returns her smile, the telephon rings.  Alice reaches for it. ALICE (cont'd) I'll get it. (lifts the receiver) Hello. (there Is no response; she repeats) Hello...hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the other end of the line there is a little click as receiver is hung up.  Alice looks at Oliver. ALICE (cont'd) They hung up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the receiver back on the cradle and pushes the phone aside.  Suddenly she remembers another evening when the telephone had rung.., ALICE (cont'd) (thoughtfully) That's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happened once before like that.  The telephone rang.  I answered.  There was someone on the other end of the line; I could almost hear them listening.  And then there was a little click, as they put up the receiver.  That was the night I was followed on the transverse...  (looks at Oliver and takes his sleeve) Oliver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Alice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here, I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her. ALICE (cont'd) That was Irena...I know it was Irena who called.  She could call from downstairs.  She may be on her way up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver looks at her grimly and reaches for his hat and co

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She quickly gets into her coat and hat and picks up her pocketbook.  Oliver puts his hand on the light switch. OLIVER (cont'd) I'll have to turn out the lights from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice looks ahead. SHOT of the door into the hall, from Alice's viewpoint. door is open, and one can see out into the dimly lit hall TWO SHOT of Alice and Oliver.  She takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door's open.  We can see to get out into the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll switch off the table lights as we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver turns out the light, and together they start towar the door, the CAMERA MOVING with them.  Oliver turns out under-lit table lights.  Halfway across the room Alice st her fingers clenching in Oliver's sleeve.  There is n sof metallic click as of a door closing.  They look In the direction of the sound. SHOT of the door.  It is closed. TWO SHOT - Alice and Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to him) It's shut now.  Just a minute ago it was open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go to the door,  Oliver reaches out and turns the kn then he turns to look at Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice seizes his arm.  In the darkness, to one side of th there Is a sound like a snarl.  Instinctively Oliver and Alice step backward, away from the sound in the dark. The CAMERA MOVES with them.  They bump into a desk, grope their way around It. From the darkness following them, there is a whisper of light, padded feet ГўВЂВ” a delicate tick, tick of claws the floor.  Alice bumps Into the glassy coldness of the w cooler, gasps in fright, arid pushes it away from her. Th is a crash, the sound, of glass breaking, and then the throaty gurgle of water spilling out onto the floor.   It is silent then.  Alice and Oliver are creeping back do between a row of filing cabinets.  Now there comes again, pursuing them, the whispering tread of soft paws. Alice a Oliver are against the further wall now. Alice is pushed behind Oliver, her back against the wall. Panic-stricken, she begins to whimper with restrained hysteria.  Her nerv are cracking up. Oliver tightens his hold on her wrist. cold sweat breaks out on his forehead.  He reaches in his pocket, and pulls out a book of matches.  He lights one.  It throws a faint glow around them.  Shadows flicker acro their faces.  Behind them the match light dimly reveals t letters "Project No. 457." They peer into the darkness. SHOT of the dark, shadowy room. Alice is sobbing with fright, trying to restrain her fear that the sobs, when they come, are the more terrifying to hear.  Oliver calls into the darkness. OLIVER (cont'd) Irena...Irena... (the match light begins to flicker) Irena...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The match light dies.  He lights another and pushes the b of matches into Alice's hands. OLIVER (cont'd) Keep lighting them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice lights a match, the scene is brighter. OLIVER (cont'd) Leave us, Irena.  Leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of the darkness before Alice and Oliver. Oliver's match light flickers out before Alice's match al goes out, Oliver looks up to one side. CLOSEUP of a T-square hanging beside him on the wall. As Oliver reaches up to got the T-square, Alice's match l dies.  In the darkness, he snatches the T-square  Alice lights another match.  Oliver has the T-square in his han and in the eerie light, a shadow is thrown on the wall ab and to one side of him.  He leans forward tensely.  He sp with deep feeling, the name of God in tones of reverent supplication. OLIVER (cont'd) Irena...I beg you, leave us In peace. (pauses) In the name of God --Irena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a snarl.  The match light flickers out. Again Al lights a match.  Oliver leans forward, still gripping the square In his hands. The darkness.  There is only silence.  Beyond, the door stands open, and one can see out into the hall again. Oliver takes Alice's hand and starts back toward the hall She holds a match in her free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver close the door to the office behind them stand in the dimly-lighted hallway.  They look down the h SHOT of the elevator, from their point of view, as it sta waiting. Alice takes a step toward the elevator, but Oliver stops OLIVER (cont'd) Let's go down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They turn and go toward the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Alice and Oliver reach the bottom of the first flight stairs, Alice stops, leans up against the railing, and co her face with her hands.  Oliver puts an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't Alice. It's gone. Everything's all right. Don't be afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifting her face to his, smiling) I'm not afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, and kisses her lips.  They turn and continue d the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver come out of the doorway marked "Stairway They stop short. Oliver points off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT - Alice and Oliver. She looks beyond the elevators, and her fingers tighten on Oliver's arm. He follows the direction of her gaze. SHOT of the revolving door, from their viewpoint.  It is spinning emptily, as if someone had just passed through. TWO SHOT - Alice and Oliver.  Alice looks about her and t up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena's perfume -- strong ГўВЂВ” sweet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go out the revolving door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver stand on the sidewalk.  He tries to peer through the night.  There is a heavy ground fog, white an still. The night is windless and quiet. Alice puts one ha to her forehead and sways a bit.  She forces a grin at hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to have a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Judd Is seated in a chair.  The phonograph is playing music for Irena's song. The phone starts to ring. Judd lo at it.  The phone rings again, and he picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over phone) Dr. Judd?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of Alice and Oliver at pay telephone. Alice is speaking into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We've been trying to get you on the phone, Dr. Judd. I called your hotel. (pause) Yes.  I know.  That's what I want to talk about. Are you alone? (pause) You had better leave then.  She may be on her way back now, (pause) She is dangerous, Dr. Judd.  I warn you ГўВЂВ” Hello. Hello. Dr. Judd. Dr. Judd are you there? (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice hangs up the receiver and turns to Oliver. ALICE (cont'd) I think Irena just came in. He hung up on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking her arm as they start out) We'll get a taxi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING PAST Judd, who is putting down the phone, we see Irena standing, looking at him, the open door behind her. stands up and comes toward her as she closes the, door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kept my appointment, late, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena continues to look at him with a calm, measuring sta He comes closer to her, speaking as he moves. In the b.g. record still plays Irena's music. She looks up at him, betraying no emotion. He is beside her. He kisses her han Still no emotion crosses her face. She only looks at him. JUDD (cont'd) I have never believed your story. I am not afraid of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts his arms around her, looks into her eyes. She doe not struggle, continues only to stare at him. He speaks softly to her. JUDD (cont'd) I take you in my arms. You are so very little...so soft...there is warm perfume in your hair... your body. Do not be afraid of me, Irena...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP of Irena's face, his kiss. She lifts her mouth to receive CLOSE TWO SHOT of Irena and Judd as he bends to kiss her. They kiss. He draws back from her, smiling, his arms stil around her body. CLOSEUP of Irena. This is as immobile, as expressionless shot of her face as we can achieve; there is a frightenin blankness and vacancy in this face. Then the whole head m forward slowly toward the camera, the expression never changing, not even stirring to breathe. CLOSEUP of Judd. The smile suddenly fades from his face. place is taken by shock and terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of Alice and Oliver in a taxi that is racing through streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Judd fumbles behind him for his cane, finds it, and draws dagger out. Beads of sweat stand out on his brow. He cann take his eyes off something in front of him. CLOSE SHOT of the panther screen.  Silhouetted on it are shadows of Judd and some beast-like figure as they fight. There is the sound of furniture being overturned, snarls rage from the beast, and the heavy, terrible breathing of Judd. ANOTHER ANGLE of the panther screen.  The fight is reflec in its glossy surface. Something crashes into the screen, it goes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of a taxi racing through the foggy city streets*

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of the Goya portrait. On the glossy surface of painting, two shadows are engaged in a struggle. We hear sound of the struggle o.s. SHOT of a charming table lamp.  The table on which it is is turned over, and the lamp rolls to the floor.  The lam shade rolls back, and the electric globe casts, moving shadows over the scene. SHOT of the empty bird cage swinging crazily.  Something knocks it to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The taxi draws up in front of the apartment, and Alice an Oliver got out quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOT of the table lamp still rolling back and forth, with large, moving, distorted shadows fighting. Something cros In front of the strong light, completely blotting the sce from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver come hurriedly in.  Oliver lets the door close behind him, and they start up the stairs. A man's high-pitched scream of mortal agony cuts down the stairwell.  It is followed by hideous noises, bestial snarls and growls, the crash of overturned furniture. Ali and Oliver look at each other; then they start running up the stairs.  As they reach the first landing, the sounds snarling and struggle grow louder.  There comes one piercing, human shriek of agony and then quick silence.  Again Oliver and Alice pause and look at each other, then continue on up the stairs. SHOT of the stairs a flight above Oliver and Alice. There a shadow on the stairs, moving, black, and stealthily agi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT - Oliver and Alice.  They are running up the sec flight of stairs. SHOT of the stairs above them. We can see the shadow now clearly.  It is Irena.  She is coming down the stairs.  H fur coat is only half on.  One arm is in the sleeve; the other side of the wrap is draped about her shoulders, pul across her breast as if she were holding it to hide some hurt.  She sees Alice and Oliver below her and moves stealthily back into the deeper shadows of the stairway. Alice and Oliver are passing an angle of the stairway whe Irena stands.  Neither of them sees her. CLOSEUP of Irena as she watches them go by.  Her eyes are Oliver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice and Oliver come up the stairs.  On the stairway, co down from another floor, are two old ladies in faded dres robes.  Other tenants have congregated about the open doo the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irena is on the first floor. She is  looking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling softly) Oliver!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO SHOT  - Alice  and Oliver. Oliver does not hear his n but  sensing Irena's presence,  he  stops, hesitating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr.  Reed! Oh, Mr. Reed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oliver turns in the direction of her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOTING DOWN the stairwell from the upper floor, we see Irena make a gesture of farewell to Oliver and turn away toward the street door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
